meanings.definition: The exclusive legal right to reproduce, publish, sell, or distribute an original work of authorship.
meanings.sent1: The artist obtained a copyright for their new painting.
meanings.sent2: The copyright of the book prevented others from copying it.
meanings.sent3: The copyright on the song made sure no one could steal its melody.
meanings.sent4: His copyright was like a shield protecting his creative work.
meanings.sent5: She proudly displayed her copyright certificate on the wall.

meanings.definition: To secure a copyright for a creative work.
meanings.sent1: The author wanted to copyright his latest novel.
meanings.sent2: She decided to copyright her photographs to protect them.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he would copyright his doodles to prevent imitation.
meanings.sent4: Securing a copyright felt like locking in his artistic creation.
meanings.sent5: They rushed to copyright their designs before anyone else could.

meanings.definition: The act of registering a copyright for intellectual property.
meanings.sent1: The copyright registration process was straightforward.
meanings.sent2: She completed the copyright paperwork for her software.
meanings.sent3: The office was busy with people filing for copyright.
meanings.sent4: Registering a copyright was like putting a stamp of ownership.
meanings.sent5: He understood the importance of copyright registration for his work.
